reviews.text: Mooi historisch pand aan de markt. Rondleidingen door het pand worden gegeven door Kring Vrienden van 's-Hertogenbosch.  Te boeken via dagjedenbosch.com. Een aanrader.

In dit pand is onder andere de Ombudsman van de gemeente 's-Hertogenbosch gevestigd.
Deze Ombudsman is vaak de laatste strohalm die mensen hebben.
Echter is deze commissie niet van fouten verschoond, fouten die zij zelf toegegeven hebben.

Toch weerhouden die fouten hen er niet van om 'over lijken te gaan' en medewerkers van de gemeente die hun boekje te buiten gaan een handje boven het hoofd te blijven houden ! 

Wat in een onprofessionele, bijna corrupte en incompetente organisatie resulteert.
Men zal zich hier uiteraard 'niet in herkennen' maar dat is altijd het standaard rookgordijn dat snel opgetrokken wordt om zaken binnenkamers te houden.

St. John’sChurch is one of the oldest medieval architectural monuments in Latvia. Church was built in the beginning of 13th century during the Christianization of Baltic’s for the purposes of the Livonian Holy Order because residence of the order was located in Cēsis; therefore Cēsis became one of the most important German power centers in the Baltic’s from 1237 up to 1561

Pretty, very old, church with a terrifying (fun) option to tour the bell tower. The church is pretty, but let's be honest - all churches from that era are. For mere 2€ you can take your life in your hands and climb the stairs of the ~65m bell tower for a view. Most of the thrill comes from navigating the near-black steep staircase on your way up. Still, I enjoyed it.

The church facade still awaits restoration, but the community seems to be very active. The guide, a senior lady, is very vigorous, helpful and gave lots of information, as did the exhibitions inside. The tombs of the Masters of the Livonian Order and the stained glass with the Latvian coat of arms, which was miraculosly preserved by the pastor during the Soviet time are impressive.
Фото та відеозйомка коштує 200 UAH. Касса на вході
Mağralar manastırına ücretli 3 giriş kapısından biri, üstü kilise olarak kullanılıyor. İçeride gezilecek müze çan kulesi ve diğer yapılar için ek ücretler ödemeniz gerekiyor.

Церковь имеет и еще одно назначение - вход на территорию Лавры .
Недалеко растет старый куст древовидного пиона .
Аромат при цветении - сногсшибательный .
Free entry.. Perhaps one of the very few interesting places in Ankara. You'll find all about Ataturk.. his pictures, life size wax statue and his grave. Must visit place!

The place as a poetic painting of every part in which a description of the championship and courage.The fragrant anniversary and long history of the heroes of this great country.You can feel the spirit of heroes and brave fighters and you wander around this great edifice.
I love it.

A magnificent complex perfectly encapsulating the importance of Atatürk as founder and shaper of the modern Republic of Turkey. This is definitely one of the foremost sights for any visitor to Ankara. Just remember that this is almost a sacred place for many Turks and so act especially respectful here.
After Traveling to ankara I felt in love with the city! Amazing! Best city in middle east! Specially Young people are great in Turkey. Love it

Minimalistic monument, nice to see. When we visited it was snowing heavily so it wasn’t so easy to approach cause the stairs were frozen and it was slippery. Besides the weather conditions, there aren’t many signs so we didn’t even realise there was also a museum and not just the monument so we missed that part which I later heard was the best part :/ And the securities on the entrance were really nice and friendly.
